titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Council on African Studies, Yale University, Records
Council on African Studies, Yale University, Records
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday November 30, 2018 at 11:05

did.unittitle: Council on African Studies, Yale University, records

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The records consist of working papers of the Yale Council on African Studies.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Yale Center for International and Area Studies. Council on African Studies

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 37 (YRG 37), Records of associations, institutes, centers, and organizations affiliated with Yale.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The records were transferred from the African Collection, 2003.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright for materials authored or otherwise produced as official business of Yale University is retained by Yale University. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Council on African Studies, Yale University, Records (RU 927). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Council on African Studies at the Yale Center for International and Area Studies supports and coordinates the study of Africa within Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The records consist of working papers of the Yale Council on African Studies.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The records are arranged by accession.

controlaccess.subject: Research institutes
controlaccess.corpname: Yale Center for International and Area Studies. Council on African Studies
